purpose.summary: A structured framework for improving sales execution, detecting pipeline risk, and increasing forecast integrity for fintech and data providers selling into institutional buyers.
objectives: Create consistent language for evaluating deal health
Prioritize actions based on buyer signals rather than seller intuition
Provide shared visibility into execution gaps across teams

pillars.name: Buyer Alignment
pillars.description: Evaluates whether the buyer has internal motivation and organizational clarity around the problem and solution.

pillars.name: Momentum Signals
pillars.description: Identifies whether the deal is advancing through observable buyer activity.

pillars.name: Value Translation
pillars.description: Measures whether the seller has translated the offering into buyer-defined outcomes.

pillars.name: Execution Readiness
pillars.description: Determines whether both teams are ready to execute commercially and operationally.

deal_progression_stages.name: Discovery Validation
required_buyer_behaviors: Confirms problem exists and is meaningful
Provides context on impact, stakeholders, and timeline

deal_progression_stages.name: Value Confirmation
required_buyer_behaviors: Articulates value in their own language

deal_progression_stages.name: Momentum Activation
required_buyer_behaviors: Drives follow-up steps without vendor chasing

deal_progression_stages.name: Execution Planning
required_buyer_behaviors: Engages procurement, legal, compliance, or technical teams
Collaborates on workflows, integration, and implementation timelines

deal_progression_stages.name: Commitment
required_buyer_behaviors: Provides commercial approval or budget confirmation
Advances to contract review and signature process

execution_score.description: Each opportunity is scored across the four execution pillars. The total score reflects overall deal health and readiness.

pillar_scoring.meaning_of_low_score: Buyer is unconvinced, unclear, or misaligned on the problem, impact, or solution priority.
Observable buyer activity is weak, inconsistent, or absent; deal may be stalling.
Messaging is not resonating; buyer cannot clearly articulate the value or business outcome.
Operational, technical, or governance blockers are unresolved, making execution unlikely in the near term.

total_score_interpretation.label: Strong Execution Position
total_score_interpretation.description: High likelihood of close. Buyer is aligned, momentum is visible, value is clear, and execution paths are defined.

total_score_interpretation.label: Conditional Execution Position
total_score_interpretation.description: Deal can close but one or two pillars are weak. Requires targeted intervention to reduce execution risk.

total_score_interpretation.label: Fragile Execution Position
total_score_interpretation.description: Low probability or stalled opportunity. Multiple gaps across alignment, momentum, value, or readiness.

usage_steps: Identify the current stage of the opportunity based on buyer behavior, not seller activity.
Score each execution pillar from 1–5 using observable evidence rather than opinion.
Identify the weakest pillar and define a specific action to strengthen it.
Confirm the Required Next Buyer Action (RNBA) that will validate progress.
Update forecast category and narrative based on pillar scores and buyer behavior.
Use trends across opportunities to identify systemic execution gaps in the sales process or messaging.

examples.name: Data Provider → Hedge Fund
examples.context: Selling a new dataset to support quantitative research and trading strategies.
examples.interpretation: Buyer is aligned and sees value, but execution readiness is weak. Technical and governance paths are unclear.
examples.recommended_focus: Clarify integration path, data governance requirements, and implementation resources with technology and risk stakeholders.

examples.name: Workflow SaaS → Regional Bank
examples.context: Digitizing a manual, spreadsheet-driven internal workflow.
examples.interpretation: Execution is fragile. The buyer has not fully aligned stakeholders, and momentum is low.
examples.recommended_focus: Revisit the problem framing, strengthen the champion, and secure cross-functional alignment before advancing scope.
